availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph M. Graves (Hopkinsville, Christian County, KY, schoolteacher and deputy sheriff)

body.p: Hopkinsville, Christian County, Kentucky, school teacher and deputy sheriff. Kentucky native. Married Lucy Ann Scott in Christian County, Kentucky on November 6, 1838. Father of James C. Graves and John J. Graves. School teacher in McCracken County, Kentucky in 1850. Deputy sheriff in Hopkinsville, Kentucky in 1860. Nominated as sheriff for Christian County, Kentucky at Provisional Government of the State of Kentucky session in December 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, District 2, p. 359.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, Hopkinsville, p. 669.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Christian County Marriages, Film 001942963, p. 157.
KYR-0004-033-0036.
